btWUUP1ui6fmOTnkfS5izQ.text: One of the things on my list to do during my recent vacation to London was a traditional English tea. However, as London is much more expensive than I anticipated it to be, and I'm from NYC, I soon realized that a traditional high tea at a hotel was out of my budget. Tea & Tattle, while very cute, isn't what I had in mind. However, I was very happy with me decison to come here. The portion sizes were great! By the time we were done with our sandwiches & scones we had to ask for the huge piece of cake to be wrapped so we could take it home and eat it later. If you're looking to do a tea in London and don't want to spend upwards of $100 at a hotel, this is a great alternative.

5sytCGrRMZA3WgwnrgFMiQ.text: Tea and Tattle is a charming tea shop located right across the British Museum. Definitely pay a visit here if you are ever in the area! The tea menu included a good variety of teas. A few that caught my eye were the Kenyan Fannings, Darjeeling, Lapsang, and Ceylon, because I wasn't too familiar with the flavor characteristics of these. In the end, I opted for the Ceylon tea. Turns out Ceylon is an aromatic bold black tea.The scones were delicious, although it was on the smaller side. The clotted cream and jam were pre-applied, but they definitely didn't skimp. The damson jam was delicious by the way. I would also like to point out the interesting mix of wall decor. One side of the wall was dominated by an Oriental themed wall paper, while the rest were spotted with Yue Minjun prints, Chinese propaganda posters, and antique Victorian prints. Very interesting...

wtJcwxCjHTkwSoyI06nmlQ.text: The overall experience is charming, nestled in a little shop down the stairs.  I ordered tea and a scone.  The tea was good, though not steeped long enough.  The scone was also good, not great, but the clotted cream and jam were amazing! I strongly recommend the strawberry pepper jam.  The presentation of the scone was not traditional, in that the cream and jam came pre-applied, but it was still very good.

xiasD5f_4JUHJup3edw9wg.text: With all those modern US-influenced coffee shops popping up everywhere it is almost comforting to come across a good old fashioned tea room. And the same goes for sliced cucumbers in triangular sandwich quarters (just a shame, the bread was a bit dry on one side  tut, tut). They have a good selection of teas which unfortunately staff don't seem to be encouraged to sample.Tea and Tattle provides the perfect backdrop for an intimate chat in civilised surroundings. When the company you're in is more important than the food and drink you are consuming, this is the perfect place.

L8FVEYKRPvWpWdrMIGSD_w.text: Really good and reasonable! I had to come here by myself since my friend was working at that time, but they offered an afternoon tea set for one person, and it was the perfect proportion! I enjoyed the pretty plates and cups too. While I consider food in UK generally sub-par, I really enjoyed the food at Tea and Tattle! Free wi-fi is a plus as well.

xoDTTUfA2zKpdrlX6J_5zg.text: I stopped in here with a friend after visiting the British Museum. The guy working there told us that he was closing early, but said that he would still be happy to serve us. We had a fantastic tea of cucumber, chive and cream cheese sandwiches and smoked salmon, creme fraiche and cucumber sandwiches, earl grey tea, scones with delicious clotted cream and raspberry jam, and decadent sponge cake and scrumptious coffee walnut cake. We really appreciated the fast and gracious service of the guy, even though he had begun closing up. Would definitely return!

A_WbkzHLv-PEOCJ-FBLudQ.text: Very nice and cosy place. We had the traditional afternoon tea from the set menu for two. Both the quality and the quantity are good. For tea we had assam and darjeeling, served with their lovely tea cup sets. I ordered the crab & avocado sandwich and my friend the chicken and cucumber one. I'd say hers is much better, although mine is the most pricy one on the sandwich menu. My favorite has to be the lovely scones. They are not as small as I once read in a review. Normal size, with lovely jam. I loved my strawberry & black pepper jam, and my friend's Damson jam one is not bad either. The cake slice for me is very big. I wasn't really expecting such a big slice. I loved the coffee and walnut one, but my friend said her chocolate one is a bit too sweet. They also served us sweet cool lemonade, which I didn't know was part of the set menu.Overall, I'm very happy with the afternoon tea I had. I think it's well worth the price.The service is good as well. The waiter was very friendly. It's somewhere I can go many more times.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Scones and cakes.
Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom

AtzZXWYBfBtAZhBhZHtPcA.text: Conveniently opposite the British Museum, this was the perfect place to cool down after walking around the exhibits in the afternoon. It's modelled after traditional tea rooms and uniquely decorated in a chinois style. Very pretty, and with an added bonus of not being a tourist trap, being hidden below a bookshop. The traditional tea set menus have a pretty standard price of £15, including tea, cake, sandwiches and scones. I had the scone and tea special offer for £5.90, with raspberry and vanilla jam (very delicious) and Ceylon tea. The only flaw was the scones were on the small side. I'll definitely be dragging my group of girls here!

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Tea & Tattle

2IwoCVhesK4rDLk4crO84A.text: This unassuming cafe located downstairs in the Arthur Probsthain book store was a wonderful discovery as I made my way to the British Museum. I ordered the afternoon tea which included your choice of sandwich, dessert, scone and tea. I elected to have the ploughman sandwich with a slice of lemon drizzle cake, scone and Earl Grey tea. Whew, that's a ton of food at an excellent price at only £10! I don't think I've ever paid such a great price for afternoon tea anywhere.The sandwich was DELICIOUS! Nothing much to it, but the cheese and chutney was wonderful. The scone was smothered in clotted cream and jam the way I like it. The lemon drizzle cake was just ok, but at that point, I was so full. The waitstaff was so friendly and very attentive. I didn't expect such a great place so close to a large tourist attraction. As an added bonus, the dishware was very elegant which enhanced the experience of having proper tea. As far as ambiance is concerned, very nice and purposely decorated. From what I saw, the coffee menu was quite extensive with a good selection of baked treats like cupcakes, albeit I was too full to have one of those. I recommend this place to anyone who would like to escape the long lines at the museum and have a great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom

FHu252dlVI4R_S_JmA7yMg.text: I just loved this tiny tea shop right next to the British Museum. Down some stairs you'll find six tables, the clatter of tea cups, the murmur of conversations. The sandwiches--I had cucumber with cream cheese and chives, my pal had a ham and something--we're fresh and plentiful, not small tea time triangles but four real sized triangles. With a pot of earl grey it was a perfect lunch before getting pushed around looking at mummies.

ZqAiHi7tWhLWOWIhDdu65g.text: We got the cream tea here after seeing the glowing reviews on yelp, and I must say I was slightly disappointed. The tea room was cute, and location was great as it's right by the British museum, but the tea selection was simple, and the scone (singular) was really tiny. The scone came toasted, and with cream + jam. You get a choice of several different jam, and the cream was nice and thick, but there was a little too much jam for my taste. All in all, it wasn't bad, but I would definitely not go out of my way to get tea there. There are a lot of places that serve better scones and tea at comparable prices.

iJaRn65ALDOrk01z3gJ-Tg.text: I really like this place, as it is a hidden gem. Underneath a cute bookstore, with the perfect decor for afternoon tea, fancy china and all! They are also very heavy on the clotted cream, which is a plus! Classy, but not fussy.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Tea and scone combo!

5zjFfZBfDiCRr1CSRi93fA.text: This place is adorable. It is a great alternative to the super-busy Starbucks down the street!They have an excellent sandwich menu (and all the sandwiches are big!), delicious cakes, and a marvelous selection of teas. The scones are always served warm. It's in the basement of a bookshop, so it's the perfect place to come on a rainy day. I love bringing my friends here to give them a proper afternoon tea that's a very affordable alternative to Fortnum and Mason - about 12 pounds for a full cream tea. They also have a selection of books about the history of tea and coffee available for perusing while you sip.Edit/note: the two guys running it are eerily similar-looking brothers. In case you think your waiter has suddenly been switched out for someone just a bit taller in a different shirt.

KTTt5rEbge8YKbr46Ql23w.text: This place was a convenient options to give my friend the "high tea" experience on our way to the British Museum.  Pros: We were able to get high tea for lunch because the pleasant staff accommodated us and made everything up for us fresh.  The quality and taste of everything was good.  The location was very convenient to grab a bite and meet up with friends.  Cons: Pricey and portions for small, but it worked for me as I was a little overly fed on our trip.

pyPjl6LefK-hoGEIPpdf8A.text: I'll bet people say "sorry" a lot in this room. The café itself is a nice enough little space with charming wooden tables - probably a very nice place to sit, sip a cup of cha, and do some typing. Being in a bookshop though it seemed oppressively quiet to me however, and thus it compels you to ask what you want quietly - instant fail, IMHO. What was more of a fail, however was that a takeaway cappuccino (it was a small cup - I'm guessing 250mL size) was £2, and £2.50 for a danish. And if you're ever wondering about how much bearing technique has on coffee outcome: if you don't tamp the beans like this guy didn't, even if you start with high quality beans - they use Monmouth - you wind up with a comparatively insipid brew. And for £2 for a thimbleful, that isn't good enough.

RgZaOdowxQIdpHTbc2TD3g.text: I agree with the other posters in regards to teeny tiny scones.  I paid £3 for "Scones".  When my scone came and it was so tiny I thought, wow this place must bake them as you eat them!  I wonder if we'll get two more or just one...  HAH!  What a dope I am.  I paid $4.60 for a scone that was slightly larger than a Reese's Peanut Butter Cup.  I asked the server if all the scones were that small and he said that perhaps it was slightly smaller than usual but that was about right.  Then he asked if I would like another!  I told him that at £3 a scone I definitely would NOT like another.  He shrugged and walked away.  I went to visit parliament and got a MUCH larger scone with the clotted cream, jam and a pot of tea for a little over £4.  I just don't think this place is worth it if you are at all minding how much you're spending.

94KVcNWgsk79hiObgU80jg.text: I loved this place! My two friends and I stumbled upon it after leaving the British Museum. We wanted to try cream tea so we each ordered the afternoon tea deal (tea, homemade lemonade, sandwiches, scones with jam and clotted cream, and cakes). Unlike a few of the other reviewers, I thought they had respectable tea and jam selections. The food was great tasting and plentiful and the room was small but adorable. The service was great too. This was one of our favorite moments of our vacation in Europe and we tried to replicate this tea experience several other times in both London and Edinburgh to no avail. I highly suggest going here if you have a chance.

OX-embqZI3vd7Et3KVrlrA.text: This is an adorable tea shop! We stopped in for a quick spot of tea before heading to Paris and we were not disappointed with our green and Ceylon tea selections. Also, the scones were possibly the best I have ever had! The combination of clotted cream and raspberry vanilla jam was simply irresistible. Definitely worth stopping in!

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom

P1IgQaYlGAXXdf_WRFD5hQ.text: The tea was fresh (I got the jasmine green and loved it) and delicious and the fruit was fantastic as well. My friends and I ordered scones and croissants to go along with our breakfast and everything tasted incredible. If you're ever visiting London, I highly recommend you make this your spot for getting morning tea because you won't regret it.

kVk0bkGYl46-wII9ZUVVxg.text: Afternoon tea is something we need in America. Stat. I decided this after my visit to Tea and Tattle.For a cool £17 you get: your choice of tea, a sandwich, scones of your choice with clotted cream, lemonade, and a slice of cake. In other words, if you're on a low-carb diet, stay far, far away. Everyone else: hurry in.I would recommend everything I ordered: Darjeeling tea, the chicken sandwich with lemon mayo and cucumber on rosemary bread, strawberry-pepper jam on scones with clotted cream, and carrot cake. It was the perfect fuel for a late afternoon at the British Museum, 'cause god knows you don't want to see the Rosetta Stone on an empty stomach.Props to good service here. At one point I eavesdropped on the conversations of my few fellow diners (this place only seats about 15) and realized we were all American. The friendly lady serving us didn't seem phased by our lack of knowledge of this great gustatory tradition.Book ahead of time, or be prepared to wait a bit in the African bookstore upstairs. I think we waited about 10 minutes (we didn't have a reservation and came in at around 4:00), though it was totally worth it.

LofibBowhKBr_xmdSIdh3w.text: Tea and Tattle was absolutely lovely. We had a wonderful tea for two. Sandwiches were really good and the cakes and scones were divine. Definitely recommend this to anyone who loves a great tea place!! Plus it's right across the street from the British museum.

sr9btrGBQGX7A4peldfQ7g.text: I'm so happy I got to try this place! I wanted to sit down for some tea after visiting the British Museum (which was pretty exhausting, not gonna lie) and saw this place across the street. It looked cute enough from the outside (my judgement criteria...) so I went in. At first I was confused because I saw a cashier and a bookstore behind him, so I thought I might have walked into the wrong door. But then I figured out that the actual tea place (for sit-in) was downstairs so I wandered down there and was seated at this cute little table in a cozy corner. I was given a menu and even though they had lots of options I'm a lover of green tea so it was definitely Sencha Tea for me.Within 5 minutes the tea came out in the CUTEST teapot and the most gorgeous teacup. And oh my goodness, the tea! The sencha tea was the best green tea (and probably tea, in general) I've ever had - it was SO incredibly fresh and authentic, and it tasted beautiful (I think that's the first time I've ever used "beautiful" to describe taste). But it's true. Everything about this place is great: the service, the atmosphere, and - most of all - the tea. I absolutely loved my experience here.Next time (yes there will definitely be a next time) I'm for sure trying the afternoon tea menu! The person next to me got it and it looked delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Sencha Tea

8QVCSpF8VGUbSXMfwCh-kQ.text: You must try the raspberry and vanilla jam on your scones. So delicious! This place is located in the downstairs area of a book shop, make sure you don't miss the staircase leading down on your right as you enter.  Good prices for tea and scones, the combination was less than 10£. Friendly staff, cute area, and just the feel I was going for: classic tea in fine bone China in a casual area.  So with it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom

J-wJEk9R_R1JP4sDtTe06w.text: This location is great, right across from the British Museum. The ambiance is nice. My problem with it is the terrible seating arrangements. All of the tables and chairs seem to be shoved up against walls in hallways and such so that both times I've gone I feel like I have the worst table in the place....and then realize it seems they are all the worst tables in the house. The tea, scones and sandwiches were fine but I'd say the dessert was below par. I would not avoid it but neither would I seek it out.

P11IGBxQ0CSgAD0Ljj-IDA.text: Quality of food is good but it's super expensive. Given the classic British vibe you're likely to be sitting next to American tourists making fun of the British accent. Yawn. Regrettably 'Tea & Tattle' is a classic tourist trap passing off as a quaint Bloomsbury bookshop. If your a Londoner, save your money go to one of the many lower star rated cafes in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom

e97ww7vchi4RWOAF5qKa9A.text: What a fantastic place for tea!  I am so glad that we checked yelp before and found this hidden gem!  What a wonderful place.  We came here for traditional afternoon tea after we spent some time at the museum. The price range on the tea for two is just right.  We looked at so many places for tea and they all were so expensive.  Thankfully that was not the case with Tea & Tattle.We ordered the Cream Cheese, Chives and Cucumber and Mature Cheddar with Westmorland Chutney sandwiches, the Coffee and Walnut and Victoria sponge cake and the scones.  Everything was fantastic.  Unlike some of the afternoon teas that we had, this one was the perfect sized meal.  And when you're there with two people, it's also great for sharing.  The scones were perfect, not too dry.  I liked the amount of clotted cream that they put on them.  The mismatched china works so well with the entire place.  If we lived locally, I know we would go here ALL THE TIME.The only complaint was there seemed to be an issue with the bathrooms and they smelled AWFUL.  Other than that, everything was perfect.

gE_1XYJP2LJNGmI3RFGcFg.text: Cute little tea shop across the street from the British Museum! Family owned and very reasonably priced compared to other tea shops in London. Owner was super sweet. It was a tiny place so a reservation is key!

XGUQG-Q7_TYNmjK6hz8yWQ.text: As part of my trip to London this fall, I wanted to have a traditional afternoon tea. I did my homework and knew that going to one of the hotels or fancy tea houses was going to prove expensive. I got the London Pass and in the booklet i found that they offered a discount to the Tea and Tattle. I was impressed. it was a little place in a bookstore (i was in heaven!) and the staff could not be more accomodating. it was just perfect. a little on the small side, but thats what gives it it's charm. Now to the food. I had the Tea for one. The tea was amazing. i went traditional and had a pot of the Earl Grey. I had the Tuna and Cucumber sandwiches, scones with clotted cream and rasberry jam. The servings were awesome. so much so that i had to have the slice of chocolate cake as a takeaway.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Perfect setting

DUQDfcOar7WPodP6tRcZLQ.text: The place is quite and cosy ,the hostess is so nice and the tea and cake are so delicious.overall it is an amazing place

om4g-IsemVnmxyqGMw9-hg.text: Very lovely place for tea. They serve the tea as courses, so sandwich comes first then scones and cake - they really make sure you take your time with the food. Make sure you make a reservation online because the space is so small. Their scones were amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Ham, salmon sandwiches
Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Scones with English breakfast tea

5etxgDolw5EoMswHRq1EjA.text: Great little place to get a sandwich - especially if you are visiting the Museum.  I had the crab sandwich and hubby had the tuna sandwich. Both were great and just enough for a lite lunch. Service was good too; a nice family owned place.

Oz8bNj8iHya7DpPHv_KEnQ.text: Great place to have British tea in London! The jams were very creative and tea was on point.

2I9tQVADXovP2RIdLrLg0w.text: Hearty sandwiches, delicious scones with a choice of jams including strawberry black pepper and damson. The cream was just as we like it--clotted and generously applied to the home made scones. There was also a choice of cakes which were fresh and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Eclectic decor and nice and quiet.  Great to have tea out of real China cups and a teapot...somewhat rare where we live.

197BNmqG4AM5j3sRy4zxtg.text: Absolutely adorable. I was a little hungry after exploring the British Museum so I went for some afternoon tea. The place is actually a bookstore and downstairs is the location of the tea room. The dining area is small but cute and cozy. Service was prompt. They have outlets at each table so you can charge your devices. I had the afternoon tea service menu with the Assam tea, roast beef and watercress sandwiches, scones with clotted cream and strawberry & black pepper jam, and the lemon drizzle cake. It also came with homemade lemonade. Food was delicious and very filling. The lemon drizzle cake was a little too sweet for my taste as it had sugar crystals on top of it. Overall, a great meal for a decent price.

nlDXtFJLj9m4cNZZCanp9w.text: As some of the other reviewers have said, my wife and I stopped at this tea shop after visiting the British Museum: The Celts exhibition, which I shall do another review for in a moment ;).  First off, it's a nice little tea shop, with friendly staff and an old time "lyons tea house" feel. I suppose it could be described as quintessentially English; with wonderful old pictures of past times on the walls, nice wooded tables and chairs. It isn't enormous, but will accommodate a good 10 - 12 people at a time.  So we sat at our little table, I ordered a scone with cream with raspberry and vanilla jam and an Americano coffee.  My wife had some gluten free chicken, cucumber, and lemon mayonnaise chutney sandwiches and a pot of earl grey tea.  Both were a wonderful light meal after our trek around the museum.  Prices are, as you'd expect "London heavy" but worth the whole atmosphere and ambiance of this spot, well worth a visit after going to the museum.

66LZ-ZjXsIQSwzKlICDe7g.text: The tea is perfect, the food delicious, the setting ideal, and the prices reasonable. In the words of my girlfriend, "I'm in love with this place. I never want to leave."They stayed open an extra 20 minutes so we wouldn't feel pressured to eat. The setting is discrete and calm. The free wifi is a nice bonus.There really isn't anything negative to say about this place.

qfaR5LPHbQUAl_6_Y7rRqA.text: This was my first time for afternoon tea. But, being on vacation in London, I felt it was something I had to do. It was a nice experience. My daughter and I came here before going to the theater. We each had tuna with cucumber sandwiches, scones, and chocolate cake/Victoria cake. Now that I am back home, I am searching for stores that sell clotted cream. The food was delicious. The experience of an afternoon tea was priceless.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful and delicious!

E-AKdCOW1EMuUOXUAJ5L6w.text: So y'all should know that I spent my 21st birthday in London with a friend. Being a classic, all-American girl I was sad that my big day was virtually meaningless. We arranged for afternoon tea at this place and were greeted by a lovely English woman in a cute little tea shop. There were only 5-6 tables, but the experience was out of this world. They left me a birthday card, offered to take our picture, and the amount of food was fantastic for 17 euros each! Highly recommend this lovely place, you will not be dissappointed.

BVseWH3hY3ZP6WpH2WoKzw.text: The location of this tea room is very convenient- right across from the British Museum. I did not make a reservation, but the restaurant was able to accommodate me. One thing to note of this place is that, the tea room is located on the ground floor, so be prepared to take the stairs down.Service was a bit slow but the staff themselves are very friendly. I did not like that the staff did not explain the menu or that I could not select the cakes and scones I wanted. The staff rushed the ordering. I did not like the cakes or biscuits given. The scones were ok. The price was average.Overall I did not really like this restaurant.

yZ5zYKVfry4s6xeROkLcig.text: I was looking for an affordable tea house during  my trip to London and I was lucky enough to find Tea and Tattle right near the British Museum. The ambiance of the tea house was cute, however try to get seated in the main room because I was out in the room next store and the ambiance wasn't as cute, as there was computer and wires at the end of the hall. They had a good selection of teas, and I decided to do the tea and scone special for 7.20 £. I got the scone with raspberry and vanilla jam and clotted cheese. Let me tell you, I was not expecting such a tasty scone! And the tea went very well with the scone as well. I probably wouldn't go back, only because I want to experience other tea houses but had a decent experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom

CfmJI-eh9TleUwMyC2uNew.text: Yum! Best cream tea in London (and I was diligent in my research).The front door said they were full, but since I was on my own, I walked in and was able to get a table. The cream tea comes with one scone and your choice of jam. I asked for raspberry and out came a delicious scone, topped with a perfect amount of clotted cream and really tasty jam. I was in heaven. It's surprising how good this was, given its touristy location. I highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. This is how the scone is served. It was so good.

40mNNMhsvY_VOPIt4DLYOg.text: We had very necessary reservations for 4 people. Included were a 14 yr old girl and 11 year old boy.  We were seated immediately. Though we all enjoyed immensely, the 11 year old boy was the surprise. He loved his own pot of mint tea.  We had a variety of scones, which were fantastic. Likewise each person ordered their own tea sandwiches.  The 14 yr old is a bit picky but loved the grape and Brie sandwich. Wonderful tea experience especially for families.

8_pwxEiuIoZwv8aArtAGXg.text: Loved this place. The atmosphere is not too fancy but not casual either. There is a shop upstairs and the tea rooms are downstairs. It's a very cute setting with a good tea selection and the scones are fantastic.

7ufBxwdOhKFQZz8JlUr2iQ.text: The door said it was full but I went in anyhow to see my luck. They seated us!!! Scone with clotted cream and jam (raspberry, plum and strawberry) was delicious. Tea was good too. Price was reasonable despite the location.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom

qVxYZ0ghE9ssZPT51Q4S_Q.text: Really small tea shop right by the British Museum. Delicious food but I recommend the ham sandwiches. We didn't love the brie and grape;). Big selection of sandwiches so you can decide for yourself! Lovely place and delicious cakes. We would prefer not to have them put the clotted cream and jam on the scones but they were delicious and they have a scrumptious selection of jams for the scones. You can get a smoothie instead of tea, which we opted for because it was HOT when we visited a London.  We had a great time at this tea shop.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Happy customers;)
Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Yummy! Prefer to put the cream and jam on my own scone but they were delicious

uDjGOOETgouKnc5tT0Osqw.text: What a cute little tea shop! You will enjoy it here, but first thing first, call to make a reservation.  The shop is actually in the basement of a book store.  The book store is 4th generation operated and the shop has been opened since 2010.  The wallpaper mural is absolutely beautiful.  The entire shop seats less than 10 tables, I believe.  The staff is super friendly and nice.  We had the traditional tea and everything was wonderful except for the cake.  We had the chocolate cake and the chocolate walnut cake; chocolate cake didn't have enough chocolate flavor and walnut cake was dry.  I didn't ask to substitute the cake with more scones, which were delicious, but I am not sure if they allow substitution anyways. Another great thing?  It's right across from the British Museum! (If you can't make a reservation for Tea & Tattle, they actually serve afternoon tea inside the British Museum, too.  ;) )

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful China
Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Too pretty
Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Salmon sandwich

jAWJejiM1Lr7Qbj4IrHNUA.text: I hate scones, I really do. They are dry and thick with dried pieces of fruit lodged into it. But tea and tattle deviates from the sad usual and produces scrumptious  scones. Is it because they pronounce it differently over here? Or is it their jam? Either way, their jam is goodness in a jar so I purchased it right away when I saw them on the shelf. With the scones, I guess I'll never know why they are so good. My tea sandwich was also good w an impressive onion marmalade. Great food, average ambiance, average service.

iNugMGVwKIxisuD-lfVIbA.text: Cute little tea house but quite expensive for the small sandwiches you get (the other Yelpers pictures were very different to our sandwiches- we got half the size of a sandwich)! Service was very nice, but honestly too expensive( £48 for 2 people)- for the small sandwiches and store bought cakes...

21oJ0lxNcoyes-8t90HaPw.text: If you're looking for a perfect any-time tea, definitely come here. I love trying new tea rooms but I always end up coming back to Tea & Tattle. My friends and I always get the tea + scones combo and it's definitely a favorite. Fresh scones, and absolutely delicious jam (i'm pretty sure they make it themselves?). The tea is always perfectly brewed when it gets to you unlike some other tea rooms i've gone too. And there's always a friendly face when I walk in. Whoever owns this place is doing a great job.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Earl Grey tea, English Breakfast, scones with strawberry and black pepper jam, and scones with raspberry and vanilla jam.

8PsDQ-4ogVwyNTAc-K-hVw.text: Fab afternoon tea alert! Situated opposite the British Museum, you would think it's an over priced cafe, but it is so not! At £17.50 for a full afternoon tea, it's pretty reasonable, especially for the quality of food and service.Small-ish venue, v friendly and knowledgeable people working here, v tasty sandwiches, delightful and fluffy scones -with superb jams- and great (taste wise and size wise) cakes! On top of that, you get a v nice pot of your tea of choice as well as a glass of homemade lemonade with your afternoon tea. Make sure you book, otherwise you will not get a table, but even if you are a bit last minute, they will do their best to accommodate you!  I have been there a few times, and I love taking friends there so we can enjoy a nice chat in nice surroundings.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. What time is it? It has to be tea time somewhere!!
Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom

lkte2GisjlIt9ZthH_1CQw.text: Sweet little hidden tea shop. Took me in even though they were near closing. Good sweets. Very nice tea for one.

NavN2Pg25Q-22mSWs82yNQ.text: I've been to a few tea places around London due to my love of the tradition and I'm very happy that I came here.  Forget the frilly, expensive places. Tea and tattle was a hidden gem near the museum. The place holds about 8 tables so make sure to make a reservation on open table. We were seated immediately.  The sandwiches were a good portion and freshly made. And my oh my, the clotted cream is delicious! Great service and atmosphere. Not fancy and pretentious. Perfect place to relax a bit before exploring more of the city.

photos.caption: Photo of Tea and Tattle - London, United Kingdom. Yummy egg salad sandwich

uF04rZVQwHXIraKi5JjHIA.text: This is the meal highlight of our trip so far. My 10 year old son and I made a reservation, which I recommend, and were able to take our time eating. The scones were absolutely amazing. I did the tea for one and my son did a smoothie, a sandwich, and a cake. The sandwiches were filling and the cakes were delicious. The service was friendly and accommodating. I cannot recommend highly enough.

ciYRXg5gJ2yIb9oO3XQinw.text: I've been eating my way across London for the last two weeks, trying all the supposed "must try" places. Tea and Tattle is perfect.  I ordered a pot of Assam and they served it perfectly hot, very full, and with milk on the side.  The scones with clotted cream were a bit warm in the middle and perfectly balanced between moist and dry (in terms of sweetness not crumbly). The raspberry and vanilla preserves were, another reviewer suggested, the most delicious I could imagine on these heavenly bites.  For my cake, I choose the coffee and walnut cake. The slice was generous. The sweetness of the frosting complemented the coffee flavor of the cake. The frosting was neither too little or too much.  I strongly suggest that for afternoon tea, skip the Museum options across the street and come spend your money at this great bookstore (with wonderful gifts for friends back home). The tables in the tea room have plugs near by if you want to charge your phone (bring an adapter if necessary).  The staff was thoroughly friendly and gracious.  Tea and Tattle may have provided me my favorite quintessential English experience yet!

pEwICmPDehtRFJIpZUvxsg.text: I really enjoyed my time here at Tea and Tattle! The setting was casual and intimate.The food, although not quite as filling as other afternoon tea shops, was very delicious and still left me full! I bought a voucher for a traditional afternoon tea set for two. The service was quick and respectful. I highly recommend coming to Tea and Tattle for a delicious bite to eat. I really enjoyed their raspberrdy jam and cucumber and chicken sandwich!

RL7GCoYOOI-6nchvsSqDpw.text: Located near British museum.  Staff was friendly and food was delicious! One of the most wonderful tea places I've been to.  My favorite was the clotted cream and jam on the scones.  Small quaint area under bookstore. Definitely recommend reservation which were easy to make. I made reservation the night before online for 2 adults and 1 kid and was seated immediately. While we were there few people were turned away because they were fully booked.

67jUc7AxjzVqfK11mOkDGA.text: I'm so happy that I stumbled upon this adorable tea room after visiting the British Museum. It's right across the street so I was worried that it would be so busy and that I wouldn't get a table without a reservation. To my surprise, they were able to seat my party of 4 even though they were a bit on the busy side. There are about 4 rooms with tables, the decor is very soft and delicate. The staff was a little overwhelmed because they were busy, but that's understandable. The tea and desserts were wonderful and for about 3-4 pounds everything was so decently priced. My favorite was the coffee walnut cake! Wow was that amazing. If you're in the area and are craving a good cup of tea, quiet and calm ambiance and tasty sweets then definitely stop in!
